intro: Odontonema nitidum var. album, commonly known as the white-flowered odontonema, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, adding ornamental value to gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a versatile choice for tropical and subtropical landscapes.
